channel.title: Making Owner Unbannable

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“Helbound, post:23, topic:273174”][quote author=x blitz x link=topic=360541.msg2746989#msg2746989 date=1239678722]

[code] if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String victim = command.substring(8);
if (victim.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“R O T D”)) {
sendMessage(“Don’t even think about it.”);
}
else
{
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “” + playerName + " BANNING "
+ victim;
sendMessage(“Player " + victim + " successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned " + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter(
                            "C:/Documents and Settings/Jordan.pimp/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt",
                            true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

}
}
} else if(command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 1) { //made by eczema3
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");
if(file.exists()) {
String victim = command.substring(5);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully unbanned”); //King free
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
String unban = command.substring(6);
String inFile;
while((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
if(inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {
// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
} else {
out.write(inFile); //made by King Free
}

		}
	} catch(IOException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
} else {
	System.out.println("Error unbanning user");

}
}
[/code]

Try that. And That is what I mean’t by moving the string.

Once again, the java.lang.String class does NOT contain a playerName variable.
[/quote]

   The ' playerName ' variable of course is [b]Not[/b] stated within the [i]java.land.String[/i] class, it is stated within the Client.java script. A string is manipulable, the basis for the String function is what is stated within : [i]java.land.String[/i].[/quote]I hope that made you feel smart.

And, just for the record, the String class is java.lang.String; not java.land.String. ( http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/lang/String.html )

Read full topic

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:15, topic:273174”][quote author=Helbound link=topic=360541.msg2746984#msg2746984 date=1239677999]

[code] if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String victim = command.substring(8);
if (victim.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“R O T D”)) {
sendMessage(“Don’t even think about it.”);
}
else
{
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “” + playerName + " BANNING "
+ victim;
sendMessage(“Player " + victim + " successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned " + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter(
                            "C:/Documents and Settings/Jordan.pimp/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt",
                            true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

}
}
} else if(command.startsWith(“unban”) && playerRights >= 1) { //made by eczema3
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");
if(file.exists()) {
String victim = command.substring(5);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully unbanned”); //King free
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
String unban = command.substring(6);
String inFile;
while((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
if(inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {
// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
} else {
out.write(inFile); //made by King Free
}

		}
	} catch(IOException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
} else {
	System.out.println("Error unbanning user");

}
}
[/code]

Try that. And That is what I mean’t by moving the string.
[/quote]
Once again, the java.lang.String class does NOT contain a playerName variable.[/quote]

   The ' playerName ' variable of course is [b]Not[/b] stated within the [i]java.land.String[/i] class, it is stated within the Client.java script. A string is manipulable, the basis for the String function is what is stated within : [i]java.land.String[/i].

If I understand what your asking correctly you want t omake it so only your charactor can use this command, change

   if (command.startsWith("banuser") && playerRights >= 2) {

to

if (command.startsWith("banuser") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("YOUR NAME HERE")) { [br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 14, 2009, 06:33:48 am[/size][hr]or if you want it to send a message, under

add

sendMesage(“blah.”);
return;// if you try adding any code below “return;” you will get an error
}
[/quote]

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String victim = command.substring(8);
PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
if (command.substring(8).equalsIgnoreCase(“your name”)) {
sendMessage(“Don’t even think about it.”);
} else {
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = “” + playerName + " BANNING "
+ victim;
sendMessage(“Player " + victim + " successfully banned”);
appendToBanned(victim);
BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned " + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(
                    new FileWriter(
                            "C:/Documents and Settings/Jordan.pimp/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt",
                            true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }
    }
} else if(command.startsWith("unban") && playerRights >= 1) { //made by eczema3
File file = new File("./data/bannedusers.txt");
if(file.exists()) {

String victim = command.substring(5);
sendMessage(“Player “+victim+” successfully unbanned”); //King free
try {
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file));
BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file));
String unban = command.substring(6);
String inFile;
while((inFile = in.readLine()) != null) {
if(inFile.equalsIgnoreCase(unban)) {
// Leave this blank we dont want it to write a file.
} else {
out.write(inFile); //made by King Free
}

		}
	} catch(IOException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
} else {
	System.out.println("Error unbanning user");

}
}[/code] i’m not to sure if that will work but it doesn’t give any errors

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

I suck, I was following my command, lol. :o

if (cmd.startsWith("banuser")) { try { int pid = Integer.parseInt(cmd.substring((cmd.indexOf(" ") + 1))); client pBan = (client) server.playerHandler.players[pid]; if (pid < 1) { c.msgSend("Invalid pid"); return; } if (pBan.disconnected == true) { c.msgSend("Player is not online"); return; } if (pBan.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("kihomura")) { c.msgSend("Error banning user."); return; } c.writeLog(pBan.playerName, "Banned"); pBan.disconnected = true; } catch (Exception e) { c.msgSend("Error banning user."); e.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:10, topic:273174”] if (command.startsWith("banuser") && playerRights >= 2) { String victim = command.substring(8); PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim; if (victim.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name")) { sendMessage("Error banning user."); return; } PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" + playerName + " BANNING " + victim; sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully banned"); appendToBanned(victim); BufferedWriter bw = null; try { bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true)); bw.write(playerName + " banned " + victim); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } finally { if (bw != null) { try { bw.close(); } catch (IOException ioe2) { sendMessage("Error logging bans!"); } } } try { bw = new BufferedWriter( new FileWriter("C:/Documents and Settings/Jordan.pimp/My Documents/my server stuff/adminpk/banlogs.txt", true)); bw.write(playerName + " banned" + victim); bw.newLine(); bw.flush(); } catch (IOException ioe) { ioe.printStackTrace(); } finally { if (bw != null) { try { bw.close(); } catch (IOException ioe2) { sendMessage("Error logging bans!"); } } } }[/quote]
Victim has been declared as a String, and there is no playerName variable in the java.lang.String class

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I received an error:

client.java:12418: cannot find symbol symbol : variable playerName location: class java.lang.String if (victim.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("God")) { ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: SYIBlocker.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

That stupid though because that’s the symbol I use… I use playerName when I’m talking about a player’s name.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2009, 09:07:16 pm[/size][hr]I fixed it. I removed .playerName and it worked. Thanks.

item.title: Making Owner Unbannable
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

I want to make it so my admins or anyone lower than me can’t ban the player, R O T D. Here’s my ban command with my unban command connected to it.

[code] if (command.startsWith(“banuser”) && playerRights >= 2) {
String victim = command.substring(8);

        PlayerHandler.kickNick = victim;
        PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "" + playerName + " BANNING "
                + victim;
        sendMessage("Player " + victim + " successfully banned");
        appendToBanned(victim);
        BufferedWriter bw = null;

        try {
            bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("logs/banlogs.txt", true));
            bw.write(playerName + " banned " + victim);
            bw.newLine();
            bw.flush();
        } catch (IOException ioe) {
            ioe.printStackTrace();
        } finally {
            if (bw != null) {
                try {
                    bw.close();
                } catch (IOException ioe2) {
                    sendMessage("Error logging bans!");
                }
            }
        }

        try {
